msContents.summary: Images 3r-8l: Two Miracles of Mary related to events at Däbrä Mǝṭmaq. The first deals with when she showed the residents of Däbrä Mǝṭmaq the burial places of saints and martyrs, including that of Muhammad, written in a different hand. Images 8r-63r: Sword of the Trinity, Säyfä Śǝllase, ሠይፈ፡ ሥላሴ፡. Arranged for days of the week: Monday (image 13r), Wednesday (28r); Thursday (33r), Friday (42r), Saturday (53l), daily (55r), Sunday (58l). AbbCat 244, , Notice 106; StrLin 53 and 62; Textes 226–38.; EMML 1170 and EMIP 7. See ሰይፈ፡ ሥላሴ። ወመልክአ፡ ሥላሴ፡ ዘደረሰ፡ አባ፡ ስብሐት፡ ለአብ፡ (Addis Ababa: Täsfa, 1947 E.C.). Sometimes known as Zena Negaromu, ዜና፡ ነገሮሙ፡. Images 63r-74r: Image of the Trinity (Nags), Mälk‘a Śǝllase, መልክአ፡ ሥላሴ፡, incomplete at the beginning. Répertoire 20; MG 189ff. Images 74r-83l: Image of the Savior of the World, Mälk‘a Mädḫane Aläm, መልክአ፡ መድኃኔ፡ ዓለም፡, incomplete at the end. Répertoire 164. Images 83r-85r: One Miracles of Jesus Christ, written in a different hand. Images 85r-86l: Image of Mary, ሰላም ለዝክረ ስምኪ አምሳለ ሐመልሚል ጽጌ ዘገነት. Répertoire 171. Images 86r-120l: Canticle of the flower, Maḫletä Ṣǝge, ማሕሌተ፡ ጽጌ፡. Grohmann, Marienhymnen, 46–321; Osvaldo Raineri, Codices Comboniani Aethiopici (Vatican City, 2000) 108f., no. 103; Täsfa Gäbrä Śǝlasse, ማሕሌተ፡ ጽጌ፡ወሰቆቃወ፡ ድንግል። (Addis Ababa, 1964 A. M. = 1971/2). See also Fessehation Andemariam, “Mariology in the ‘Mahleta Sege’: Abba Giyorgis Gassičča’s ‘Hymn of the Flower,’” MA Thesis, Salesian Pontifical University (Rome, 1994). Images 120l-123l: Chant for the entry of the Priests (Nags), written in a different hand. Images 123r-129l: Chant for every feast day, here designated for the Feast of Mika'el on 12 Hedar. Images 129r-132l: Table of Haleluya Chants, Anqäṣ Haleta. አንቀጽ: ሃሌታ:. Images 132r-143l: Ordinary of the Mass, Śǝrǝ`atä Qǝdase. ሥርዓተ፡ ቅዳሴ፡. Image 143l: Historical record of events from 1857 EC, after the victory of Maqdala through 1874, with Menilek and King Takla Haymanot of Goggam fought each other. Images 145r-149l: Hymn "Praise to You, O Christ, Savior of the World." The owner, ልደተ ወልድ, is mentioned throughout. His full name, ልደተ ወልድ ባንጀው, is mentioned on image 120l, which also gives the name of the scribe, ወልደ ማርያም. Illuminations are added recently over text.
